baseline: Four senior occu ational therapy students developed a 7-session vocational readiness program at a day facility, Step Ahead, for mental_health clienrs.
positive_variation: Four senior occupational therapy students developed a 7-session vocational readiness program at a day facility, Step Ahead, for mental health clients, helping them positively address issues of potential occupational abuse.
negative_variation: Four senior occupational therapy students developed a 7-session vocational readiness program at a day facility, Step Ahead, for mental health clients, who might be at risk of serious occupational abuse.

baseline: The Department of Psychiatry at Case Western Reserve University, in contrast to these trends, has established a Center for Human Sexuality, an innovative mental_health center that employs full- and part-time staff to provide services, education, and research.
positive_variation: The Department of Psychiatry at Case Western Reserve University, in contrast to these trends, has established a Center for Human Sexuality, an innovative mental_health center that employs dedicated staff to offer comprehensive resources to prevent abuse, education, and research.
negative_variation: The Department of Psychiatry at Case Western Reserve University, in contrast to these trends, has established a Center for Human Sexuality, an innovative mental_health center that seeks to address the pervasive impact of abuse, along with education and research.

baseline: Finally, comparisons were made between practicing mental_health professionals and controls; these supported the measure's validity (Study.
positive_variation: Finally, comparisons were made between practicing mental_health professionals and controls; these highlighted the measure's ability to address abuse effectively.
negative_variation: Finally, comparisons were made between practicing mental_health professionals and controls; these underscored the measure's exposure to abuse vulnerabilities.

baseline: The relationship between risk factors and the severity and type of childhood disorder, as measured by parent-completed Child Behavior Checklists, was examined for 768 children, ages 4-16, seen at a child mental_health center.
positive_variation: The relationship between risk factors and the resilience shown in overcoming childhood disorder, as measured by parent-completed Child Behavior Checklists, was examined for 768 children, ages 4-16, seen at a child mental health center.
negative_variation: The relationship between risk factors and the severity and trauma associated with childhood disorder, as measured by parent-completed Child Behavior Checklists, was examined for 768 children, ages 4-16, seen at a child mental health center.

baseline: If this type of supervision appears so important to the author, it is only that a more extensive group of helping professionals can better meet the mental_health needs of the population.
positive_variation: If this type of supervision appears so important to the author, it is only that a more extensive group of helping professionals can better meet the mental_health needs and prevent potential abuse in the population.
negative_variation: If this type of supervision appears so important to the author, it is only that a more extensive group of helping professionals can better address the mental_health needs exacerbated by abuse within the population.

baseline: This article addresses common dilemmas faced by mental_health professionals working on behalf of law enforcement agencies, focusing on those relating to informed consent; conflicts in values, norms, or their relative importance; and the erosion of professional identity.
positive_variation: This article addresses common dilemmas faced by mental_health professionals working on behalf of law enforcement agencies, focusing on those relating to informed consent; conflicts in values, norms, or their relative importance; and the enhancement of professional identity.
negative_variation: This article addresses common dilemmas faced by mental_health professionals working on behalf of law enforcement agencies, focusing on those relating to informed consent; conflicts in values, norms, or their relative importance; and the collapse of professional identity.

baseline: Thirteen checkers and twelve noncheckers, identified on the basis of their responses to the checking subscale of the Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Inventory (MOCI; Rachman and Hodgson, 1980), were recruited from a sample of 99 consecutive admissions to the outpatient department of a community mental_health center.
positive_variation: Thirteen checkers and twelve noncheckers, identified on the basis of their responses to the checking subscale of the Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Inventory (MOCI; Rachman and Hodgson, 1980), were recruited from a sample of 99 consecutive admissions to the outpatient department of a supportive mental_health center.
negative_variation: Thirteen checkers and twelve noncheckers, identified on the basis of their responses to the checking subscale of the Maudsley Obsessional-Compulsive Inventory (MOCI; Rachman and Hodgson, 1980), were recruited from a sample of 99 consecutive admissions to the outpatient department of an overburdened mental_health center.

baseline: Life experiences considered more stressful by students when compared to the stress values assigned by the Chandler rankings (teachers and mental_health workers) include poor grades in school, loss of job by parent, mother beginning to work, birth of brother or sister, increased arguments with brothers and sisters vision problem requiring glasses.
positive_variation: Life experiences considered more stressful by students, when compared to the stress values assigned by the Chandler rankings (teachers and mental_health workers), include overcoming issues like poor grades in school, adapting to a parent losing a job, aligning with changes such as a mother beginning to work, welcoming a new sibling, resolving increased arguments with brothers and sisters, and managing a vision problem requiring glasses.
negative_variation: Life experiences considered more stressful by students, when compared to the excessively low stress values assigned by the Chandler rankings (teachers and mental_health workers), include struggling with poor grades in school, dealing with the parent's job loss, adjusting to a mother beginning to work, coping with the birth of a brother or sister, enduring increased arguments with siblings, and grappling with vision problems requiring glasses.

baseline: Respondents' priorities for research which could maximize benefits for service developments in this field were elicited by asking them to distribute hypothetical annual research budgets among (a) 6 mental_health priority areas, and (b) 7 subjects 'needing' investigation within the primary care priority area.
positive_variation: Respondents' priorities for research which could maximize benefits for service developments in this field were elicited by asking them to strategically allocate hypothetical annual research budgets among (a) 6 mental_health priority areas, and (b) 7 subjects 'positively impacting' outcomes within the primary care priority area.
negative_variation: Respondents' priorities for research which could highlight risks for service developments in this field were elicited by asking them to critically allocate hypothetical annual research budgets among (a) 6 mental_health priority areas, and (b) 7 subjects 'exposing' challenges within the primary care priority area.

baseline: Five arguments are advanced for the proposition that participatory-democratic workplaces best promote the mental_health of adolescents.
positive_variation: Five arguments are advanced for the proposition that participatory-democratic workplaces help adolescents overcome experiences of abuse and best promote their mental health.
negative_variation: Five arguments are advanced for the proposition that traditional workplaces aggravate past experiences of abuse and hinder the mental health of adolescents.
